[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/fn-check-client/src/get_pfns.rs] [Struct: Entry] [String Field Length] Are there maximum length limits on the url and public_key strings in Entry, or can attackers provide gigabyte-sized strings causing memory exhaustion? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/fn-check-client/src/get_pfns.rs] [Struct: Entry] [Unicode Normalization] Does the url string handling properly normalize Unicode, or can attackers use different Unicode representations of the same URL to bypass deduplication or validation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/fn-check-client/src/get_pfns.rs] [Struct: Entry] [Null Byte Injection] Can the url or public_key strings contain null bytes (\0) that cause truncation in C FFI boundaries or string processing, bypassing validation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/fn-check-client/src/get_pfns.rs] [Struct: Entry] [Whitespace Handling] Are leading/trailing whitespaces in url and public_key properly trimmed, or can attackers bypass exact string matching checks by adding spaces? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/fn-check-client/src/get_pfns.rs] [Function: get_node_infos()] [Allowlist String Sanitization] Does the allowlist comparison properly handle whitespace, case variations, and Unicode in account address strings, or can these be exploited for bypass? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/fn-check-client/src/get_pfns.rs] [Function: get_node_infos()] [Allowlist Bypass via Continue] When account_address_allowlist is non-empty and address not in list, the code uses 'continue' - does this skip ALL validation, potentially allowing invalid data structures to persist in memory? [File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/fn-check-client/src/get_pfns.rs] [Function: get_node_infos()] [Invalid Entry Accumulation] Can the invalid_node_address_results HashMap grow unboundedly if attackers provide many invalid entries, causing memory exhaustion even if they don't bypass allowlist? [File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/fn-check-client/src/get_pfns.rs] [Function: get_node_infos()] [Valid/Invalid Separation] Is the separation between node_infos (valid) and invalid_node_address_results (invalid) enforced, or could race conditions or logic errors cause entries to appear in both? [File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/fn-check-client/src/get_pfns.rs] [Function: get_node_infos()] [Return Value Interpretation] Do consumers of this function properly handle the case where both HashMaps are empty (all entries filtered by allowlist), which might indicate a misconfiguration attack? [File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/fn-check-client/src/get_pfns.rs] [Struct: Entry] [Dead Code Field] The metrics_port field has #[allow(dead_code)] - is this field truly unused, or could it be exploited in unused code paths that lack proper validation? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/fn-check-client/src/get_pfns.rs] [Struct: Entry] [Public Visibility] Are the Entry struct fields appropriately private to prevent direct construction bypass, or could external code create Entry with invalid field combinations? (Medium)
